summary.purpose: Defines fundamental utility types and a geographic coordinate interface used throughout the platform.
summary.problem_solved: Provides lightweight, reusable type primitives for numeric-indexed maps, generic string-keyed objects, and GPS coordinate pairs, eliminating repeated ad-hoc type definitions across services.

exports.name: NumberObject
exports.description_one_line: A generic map with numeric keys and numeric values

exports.name: TObject
exports.description_one_line: A generic string-keyed map with a configurable value type

exports.name: Geo
exports.description_one_line: A geographic coordinate pair with latitude and longitude

symbols.name: NumberObject
symbols.description_one_line: A generic map with numeric keys and numeric values

details.what_it_does: Defines a plain JavaScript object type whose keys are numbers and values are numbers. Useful for lookup tables, frequency maps, or ID-to-value mappings where both key and value are numeric.

minimal_correct.title: Use NumberObject as an event-ID-to-count map

symbols.name: TObject
symbols.description_one_line: A generic string-keyed map with a configurable value type

details.what_it_does: Defines a generic plain JavaScript object type with string keys and a type parameter T for the value type. Used widely across entity interfaces (Car.camera_installation_details, Car.gov_info, GprsItem.details, etc.) as a flexible container for heterogeneous key-value data.

minimal_correct.title: Use TObject as a camera installation details map

extensive_correct.title: Use TObject<any> for a mixed-value metadata map

symbols.name: Geo
symbols.description_one_line: A geographic coordinate pair with latitude and longitude

details.what_it_does: Represents a geographic point using WGS-84 decimal-degree coordinates. The lat field is the latitude and lng is the longitude, both typed as number. Used on Site.location, Client.geo, and LastLocationCar (as separate lat/lng fields) throughout the platform.

returns.description: An object with numeric lat and lng properties representing a geographic coordinate.

minimal_correct.title: Create a Geo coordinate for Tel Aviv
minimal_correct.code:
import type { Geo } from 'akeyless-types-commons';

const telAviv: Geo = { lat: 32.0853, lng: 34.7818 };

incorrect.title: Using lon instead of lng
incorrect.why_incorrect: The interface uses 'lng' (not 'lon'). Using 'lon' will cause a TypeScript type error and the coordinate will be ignored at runtime.
